Daniela,

I am still not convinced that the reactor network is the best met=
hod 
to solve your problem. However, it is your choice. 
I glanced in your =
code and found a few things, which can result in 
this strange behavior. Fi=
rst, in the simulation loop your create 
every time the object gx on a heap=
 with the operator new without 
destroying it. Usually it is very bad idea;=
 an object, created with 
new operator should be implicitly destroyed by op=
erator delete, 
otherwise memory leakage is possible. Second, it is not nec=
essary to 
create new gas object every time, you can use the same gas objec=
t for 
all reactors. Third, you create at every loop iteration a new 
React=
orNet object, while IMHO you should only add a new reactor to 
the same Rea=
ctorNet object on every step. 

Hope it will help.   
Best regards, Anatoli=
.

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, Daniele Chiappini 
<daniele.chiappini@..=
.> wrote:

formation

Network to
> > simulate heat lo=
sses in a piston. You can do it very easy with one
> > reactor, changing th=
e heat transfer coefficient. Even you can 
introduce

dependent function for heat losses.
